intro: Weigeltia quelchii, commonly known as the Chilean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. Weigeltia quelchii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and resilience in coastal gardens.
